278.play: Her nurse is privy: Be sacrificed, some hour before his time,

279.play: Her nurse is privy: Unto the rigour of severest law.

280.play: PRINCE: We still have known thee for a holy man.

281.play: PRINCE: Where's Romeo's man? what can he say in this?

282.play: BALTHASAR: I brought my master news of Juliet's death;

283.play: BALTHASAR: And then in post he came from Mantua

284.play: BALTHASAR: To this same place, to this same monument.

285.play: BALTHASAR: This letter he early bid me give his father,

286.play: BALTHASAR: And threatened me with death, going in the vault,

287.play: BALTHASAR: I departed not and left him there.

288.play: PRINCE: Give me the letter; I will look on it.

289.play: PRINCE: Where is the county's page, that raised the watch?

290.play: PRINCE: Sirrah, what made your master in this place?

291.play: PAGE: He came with flowers to strew his lady's grave;

292.play: And bid me stand aloof, and so I did:

293.play: And bid me stand aloof, and so I did: Anon comes one with light to ope the tomb;

294.play: And bid me stand aloof, and so I did: And by and by my master drew on him;

295.play: And bid me stand aloof, and so I did: And then I ran away to call the watch.

296.play: PRINCE: This letter doth make good the friar's words,

297.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death:

298.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: And here he writes that he did buy a poison

299.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: Of a poor 'pothecary, and therewithal

300.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: Came to this vault to die, and lie with Juliet.

301.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: Where be these enemies? Capulet! Montague!

302.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: See, what a scourge is laid upon your hate,

303.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: That heaven finds means to kill your joys with love.

304.play: Their course of love, the tidings of her death: And I for winking at your discords too

305.play: Have lost a brace of kinsmen: all are punish'd.

306.play: CAPULET: O brother Montague, give me thy hand:

307.play: CAPULET: This is my daughter's jointure, for no more

309.play: MONTAGUE: But I can give thee more:

310.play: MONTAGUE: For I will raise her statue in pure gold;

311.play: MONTAGUE: That while Verona by that name is known,

312.play: MONTAGUE: There shall no figure at such rate be set

313.play: MONTAGUE: As that of true and faithful Juliet.

314.play: CAPULET: As rich shall Romeo's by his lady's lie;

315.play: CAPULET: Poor sacrifices of our enmity!
